parttime employment position within the village  2182016 workplace search policy all offices desks computers telephones files lockers equipment vehicles etc are the property of the village and are issued for the use of employees for business purposes only during their employment with the village an employee has no reasonable expectation of privacy when using villageowned vehicles property or equipment in this connection the village of westmont reserves the right to inspect or search an employees office desk computers emails voicemail files locker vehicle etc or any other area on the village premises or property brought onto village premises by an employee and used for business purposes to the extent permitted by law personal property which is not a fixture of the worksite such as a purse briefcase or lunch box may be searched upon permission of the employee or for cause as part of an investigation generally with the cooperation of law enforcement personnel an inspection or search will typically be conducted based upon a reasonable suspicion of employee misconduct or criminal activity or for workrelated purposes the village may conduct an inspection or search at any time with or without notice at the discretion of the village inspectors or searches shall be conducted by village supervisors andor their designees the village reserves the right to seize all drugs paraphernalia weapons or other contraband found on the villages premises and may turn over such evidence to the appropriate authorities an employee who fails or refuses to comply with this policy may be subject to disciplinary action up to and including discharge the acceptance of or continued employment with this policy constitutes consent to all of the provisions of this search policy  10132016 workplace bullying the village defines workplace bullying as repeated inappropriate behavior either direct or indirect whether verbal physical or otherwise conducted by one or more persons against another or others at the place of work andor in the course of employment such behavior violates the villages conduct policy which clearly states that all employees will be treated with courtesy and respect the purpose of this policy is to communicate to all employees that the village will not tolerate bullying behavior employees found in violation of this policy will be disciplined up to and including termination bullying may be intentional or unintentional however it must be noted that where an allegation of bullying is made the intention of the alleged bully is irrelevant and will not be given consideration when meting out discipline as with sexual harassment it is the effect of the behavior upon the individual that is important the village considers the following types of behavior examples of bullying 1 verbal bullying  slandering ridiculing or maligning a person or hisher family  persistent name calling that is hurtful insulting or humiliating  using a person as the butt of jokes  abusive and offensive remarks 2 physical bullying  pushing shoving kicking poking tripping assault or threat of physical assault  damage to a persons work area or property 3 gesture bullying  nonverbal threatening gestures or glances that convey threatening messages 4 exclusion  socially or physically excluding or disregarding a person in workrelated activities a  2 142018 americans with disability act policy the village maintains an equal opportunity policy eeo policy for all applicants and employees to supplement the villages eeo policy and in response to the americans with disabilities act the village has adopted this additional policy statement regarding discrimination against the disabled equal employment opportunity for the disabled and all other protected classes is one of the villages goals and it is expected that all employees shall assist in furthering this goal the village gives fair consideration to all qualified individuals with disabilities and affords all employees and applicants opportunities for advancement according to their individual abilities without regard to disability no opportunity for hire advancement or any other condition of employment will be diminished practices in accordance with the law the village will also reasonably accommodate qualified individuals with disabilities if an employee believes that heshe has been discriminated period will be applicable per occurrence unless the call out period overlaps with the employees scheduled work hours or overlaps with another previous call out period for that employee for example if an employee is called out to work during an evening weekend or holiday and only works 30 minutes the employee still receives two hours minimum pay at time and onehalf plus one hour of bonus pay as defined above if work continues beyond the two hour period the employee receives such at time and onehalf however when on scheduled standby the employee does not get the bonus pay as defined above 2 that period and may be the basis for further disciplinary action employees who cannot consistently demonstrate that they can respond punch in within the required time frame will no longer be eligible available at the beginning of each calendar year any employee hired in the first quarter of the calendar year will receive the full allotment of floating holidays for the year any employee hired in the calendar year in which received under no circumstances will these days be carried over to the next calendar year nor may they be cashed out if not taken or paid upon termination of employment a purposes of this section 62131 only the phrase covered family member means the employees child spouse civil union or domestic partner sibling parent motherinlaw fatherinlaw grandchild grandparent or stepparent    4202009   2162010  a  2 142018 bereavement leave fulltime village employees may be granted emergency leave of absence with pay in cases of death of an immediate family member such leave shall be granted only upon the recommendation of an employees department head and is subject to approval by the village manager upon approval such employees may be granted and compensated for up to a maximum of three consecutive working days for bereavement leave paid leave for this purpose will not be granted in instances where the bereavement leave occurs on a paid holiday previously scheduled days off weekends or in any case where payment under this section would result in paying twice for the same time off further employees may not convert preestablished paid leave vacation compensatory time or personal time to bereavement leave however if circumstances require more than the maximum three days paid bereavement leave department heads shall consider the shortnotice approval of other available vacation or personal time off   a  2 142018 jury duty fulltime village employees shall receive full pay for time not worked while serving on jury duty or testifying as a witness at the request of the village or testifying under subpoena to matters related to their employment with the village such employees are required to endorse to the village any payment received for such jury or witness duty no employee shall receive pay for time not worked while testifying as a witness in a case filed by the employee against the village its officers or employees  military service employees inducted into active military service will upon application be granted a leave of absence for the period of military service and shall be reinstated without loss of seniority or other benefits provided they return to village service within 90 days after release from military service employees who are members of a reserve or national guard unit will be granted a leave of absence for periods of active military service and shall be reinstated without loss of seniority or other benefits provided they return to village service immediately after release from active duty if a member of a reserve or national guard unit is mobilized by presidential order a leave of absence and reinstatement shall be granted in the same manner as if the employee was inducted into active military service  absences due to job related injuries village employees may be eligible to benefits under the illinois workers compensation act for injuries sustained in the course of employment such eligibility and benefits are set forth in the illinois workers compensation laws a copy of the handbook on workers compensation and occupational diseases is available from human resources or at wwwiwccilgov a reporting an onthejob injury  if an employee believes heshe has suffered an injury or illness related to employment with the village the employee must immediately report the injury or illness to a supervisor or no later than the end of the business day on which the injury occurred all injuries including those that do not require emergency medical care must be reported injuries that do not require medical care are reported on an employee first aidincident report upon being advised of an injury or illness the employees supervisor will complete an illinois industrial commission form 45 also known as the employers first report of injury or illness and a supervisors accident investigation report see human resources or the employee intranet for copies of these forms the employee will complete the employee statement form and any witnesses will complete the witness statement form the originals of all reports along with any other related data and pictures shall be completed and emailed to our third party claims administrator irma as well as to human resources within 48 hours of receiving notice of the incident the departmental safety committees shall review copies of the reports as well as the executive safety committee 1 the director or supervisor of a department shall contact the risk manager human resources director immediately at any time 24 hours a day in the event of an injury or illness or of a death 2 upon receiving verbal notice of an injury or illness requiring emergency medical care or death  or after receiving the completed reports of a less serious injury or illness the risk manager human resources director will follow up on the claim with the villages third party claims administrator b adjudication of a workers compensation claim  the villages third party claims administrator will in conjunction with the risk manager human resources director investigate the circumstances surrounding the injury illness or death of an employee in accordance with applicable law the third party claims administrator will determine if the employees injury illness or death is compensable if the claim for benefits is determined to be compensable the third party claims administrator shall distribute all appropriate benefits if the claim is determined not to be compensable the third party administrator will notify the employee or beneficiary if a death in writing of the denial if an employee disagrees with the determination made by the third party claims administrator or for any other reason the employee is entitled to file a claim for adjustment with the illinois industrial commission c benefits while on a workers compensation absence  in the event the third party claims administrator determines that the injury illness or death is compensable employees are entitled to but not limited to the following benefits 1 medical benefits the village will pay all medical bills related to an employees injury or illness that are determined to be reasonable and customary by the third party claims administrator employees requiring medical treatment while on duty will be directed to the villages occupational health provider the name and location of the occupational health provider is posted in all village facilities employees needing care will be treated and if necessary transported to an emergency care facility employees receiving medical treatment must forward all medical bills to the risk manager human resources director 2 light duty the village makes every effort to return employees to work in a light duty capacity during recovery within the scope of specific work restrictions as determined by a health care provider it is the responsibility of all employees to notify the treating health care providers of the villages availability of light duty as well as notifying the department when released for light duty work 3 injured on duty for the first three days an employee is authorized off work by the treating health care provider due to an injury or illness the employee must use time from accrued sick leave or any other category of paid time off leave if the employee does not have sick leave remaining  unless peda applies see below 4 temporary total disability ttd employees authorized off work for more than three days are entitled to temporary total disability ttd benefits ttd benefits are paid at 6623 percent of employees average weekly wage average weekly wages are calculated on injured employees regular wages for the 52 weeks prior to the date of injury employees are entitled to ttd benefits for as long as the employee is authorized off work due to the injury or illness or until the employee has reached maximum medical improvement as determined by a health care provider however these ttd benefits are released to the village as the employee receives their full rate of pay during the time of authorized injury or illness 5 permanent partial disability ppd an employee may suffer a permanent partial disability ppd as a result of an injury or illness an employee may be entitled to compensation for this disability the workers compensation act determines the amount of ppd compensation 6 permanent total disability ptd if an employee reaches the maximum medical improvement and is still medically unable to return to work the employee may be entitled to permanent total disability benefits ptd these benefits are paid at a rate determined under the workers compensation act 7 survivors benefits in the event of an employees death spouses and dependents are eligible for survivors benefits as determined under the workers compensation act 8 public employees disability act peda for the duration of up to one year under the public employees disability act peda a sworn police or fire employee is eligible for compensation equal to 100 percent of their salary if the employee is off work due to a compensable injury or illness that occurred on duty 9 illinois municipal retirement fund imrf employees ttd payments received by an employee due an onthejob injury or illness are not considered earnings by imrf such time off of work although authorized and receiving ttd payments does not count as service time for the purpose of calculating future pension benefits imrf service time may be received during such periods by applying for an imrf disability on forms available or human resources an employee is only entitled to lost time benefits if a health care provider authorizes time off work due to a compensable injury or illness upon returning to work after an injury or illness the employee will be required to use benefit time other than workers compensation benefits to attend any medical appointment during scheduled hours of work irma does not pay ttd payments for work time missed to attend medical appointments during scheduled work hours unless attending a medical appointment requested by the village d release to return to work  an employee authorized off work or released to a light duty assignment must have a duty status report completed by the treating health care provider   a  2 142018 family medical leave act employees who have worked for the village for the past 12 months and for at least 1250 hours may request up to 12 weeks of unpaid leave in accordance with the provisions of the family medical leave act of 1993 fmla such leave may be requested for the following reasons  the birth and care of the newborn child of an employee   the placement with the employee of a son or daughter for adoption or foster care   to care for an immediate family member defined by fmla as a spouse child or parent with a serious health condition   to take medical leave when the employee is unable to work because of serious health condition  or  because of any qualifying exigency as defined by the secretary of labor arising out of the fact that your spouse child or parent is deployed on active duty in a foreign country or has been notified of an impending call or order to active duty in the armed forces the employee requesting fmla leave shall make a written request stating the reasons for such request and the date desired for the start of the leave and probable date of return to work fmla leave shall not exceed a maximum combined total of 12 weeks in any 12 month period fmla leave is further explained within the family medical leave act of 1993 and within the villages policy entitled family medical leave act policy and procedure    862012 general leaves of absence a general leave village fulltime employees may manager an employee is required to exhaust any available paid vacation personal and compensatory time before unpaid general leave of absence is commenced c benefits if a leave of absence pursuant to this section exceeds 30 consecutive calendar days the employee may at the employees option remain a member of any group hospital or medical plan provided by the village to its employees provided the employee pays the full monthly premium for such coverage to the village the employee is required to begin paying this premium beginning on the 31st consecutive day of leave the premium shall include or exclude coverage for dependents at the option of the employee d extension of other benefits the village manager may extend healthlife insurance coverage for up to 24 months to long tenure fulltime this section is not entitled to accrue any other employment benefit during the leave including but not limited to vacation sick and holiday leave e resignation a village employee who fails to return from a general leave of absence pursuant to this section on the designated return date either as originally agreed or as extended by agreement shall be considered as having resigned his or her employment position with the village    882013 illinois pregnancy accommodation act the village complies with the illinois pregnancy accommodation act the act 775 ilcs 51 et seq generally the act prohibits discrimination against females based on pregnancy and childbirth and covers job applicants as well as parttime fulltime and probationary employees it further gives protected individuals opportunities to request reasonable accommodations for medical or common conditions related to pregnancy or childbirth employees should not rely on the first paragraph of this subsection to become 820 ilcs 1801 et seq vessa an employee is entitled to up to 12 weeks of unpaid leave per year andor reasonable accommodations for one of the following reasons  to seek medical attention for or recovering from physical or psychological injuries caused by domestic or sexual violence to the employee or an employees family or household member  or  to obtain services from a victim services organization for the employee or an employees family or household member  or  to obtain psychological or other counseling for the employee or an employees family or household member  or  to participate in safety planning temporarily or permanently relocating or taking other actions to increase the safety of the employee or an employees family or household member from future domestic or sexual violence or to ensure economic security  or  to seek legal assistance or remedies to ensure the health and safety of the employee or an employees family or household member including preparing for or participating in any civil or criminal legal proceeding related to or derived from domestic or sexual violence an eligible employee is entitled to up to 12 workweeks of unpaid leave during a rolling 12 month period from the date of occurrence said leave may be taken on an intermittent or reduced work schedule basis vessa leave will run concurrently with any other applicable leave for instance leave taken under vessa which also qualifies under fmla will be simultaneously designated as both vessa and fmla leave likewise absences for which an employee receives short term disability benefits for a purpose covered under vessa will be designated as vessa leave an employee can substitute or the village may require substitution of available paid vacation sick personal or similar leave for unpaid vessa leave as is appropriate for the employees situation such paid leave must be taken in accordance with the terms of this policy the substitution of paid leave for unpaid leave under vessa does not extend the 12 week leave period in the event there is no deduction made for health insurance premiums the employee is responsible for remitting payment to the village for monthly premiums the employee is required to provide the village with at least 48 hours advance notice if possible of the employees intention to take a vessa leave if the employee is unable to provide advance notice the employee must provide notice when the employee is able to do so within a reasonable period of time failure to provide the required notice may result in treatment of the absences as unexcused the employee is required to submit a certification that the employee or the employees family or household member is a victim of domestic or sexual violence and that a leave is needed for one of the listed vessa purposes this vessa certification may be satisfied by a sworn statement from the employee and other corroborating evidence police or court record documentation from a victim service organization attorney clergy or medical professional once received by the employee b definitions  domestic violence means domestic abuse sexual assault or stalking family or household member  means a spouse parent son daughter other person related by blood or by present or prior marriage other person who shares a relationship son or daughter and persons jointly residing in the same household parent means the biological parent of an employee or an individual who stood in loco parentis to an employee when the employee was a child son or daughter means a biological adopted or foster child a stepchild a legal ward or a child of a person standing in loco parentis who is under 18 years of age or is 18 years of age or older and incapable of selfcare because of a mental or physical disability c insurance payments  while on vessa leave the employee and the village shall continue to pay for their proportionate share of the villages group health dental and vision coverage if the employee is enrolled in said plans at the time vessa leave starts failure of the employee to make the employees proportionate health dental and vision insurance payments may result in cessation of coverage for the employee the village can recover the cost of any premiums paid on behalf of an employee on vessa leave who fails to return to work after exhausting their leave unless the continuation recurrence or onset of domestic or sexual violence or an event beyond the employees control prevents their return d confidentiality  all information provided to the village shall be retained in the strictest confidence except to the extent that disclosure is requested or consented to in writing by the employee or otherwise required by applicable federal or state law e accruals  during a vessa leave pension service will continue to accrue in certain circumstances  however no sick vacation personal or holiday leave benefits or seniority benefits will accrue to the employee during an unpaid leave an employee remains entitled to their benefit time that accrued prior to the leave an employee on vessa leave is encouraged to discuss these potential accruals with the human resources department f employee status after vessa leave  if an employee wishes to return to work at the expiration of the employees leave the employee is entitled to return to the same position or to an equivalent position with equal pay benefits and other terms and conditions of employment if an employee takes leave because of the employees own medical condition the employee is required to provide medical certification that the employee is fit to resume work g reasonable accommodations  the village supports vessa and will attempt to provide reasonable accommodations in a timely fashion for employees who are entitled to reasonable accommodations under vessa unless such accommodations would present an undue hardship for the village or unless the employee cannot perform the essential functions of the job even with the reasonable accommodation or unless reasonable accommodations are not required by law reasonable accommodation applies to employees who are otherwise qualified individuals and may include adjustment to a job structure workplace facility or work requirement transfer reassignment or modified schedule leave a changed telephone number or seating assignment installation of a lock implementation of a safety procedure or assistance in documenting domestic or sexual violence that occurs at the workplace or in workrelated settings in response to actual or threatened domestic or sexual violence a qualified individual is an individual who but for being a victim of domestic or sexual violence or with a family or household member who is a victim of domestic or sexual violence can perform the essential functions of the employment position that such individual holds or desires should an employee wish to request a reasonable accommodation pursuant to this policy the employee should contact the human resources director in writing a  2 142018 voting leave the village encourages its employees to exercise their right to vote in accordance with the article vi  discipline generalatwill employment a except for employees who may be subject to a separate contract or agreement or the rules and regulations of the fire and police commission village employees are at will employees and may be dismissed from employment at any time with or without cause adverse actions taken regarding an employee shall be classified as disciplinary or nondisciplinary in nature b village employees are expected to maintain reasonable standards of performance and conduct employees are to use good judgment in their positions and treat other employees and citizens of the village properly the village has established certain guidelines rules and procedures regarding disciplinary actions which must be followed by employees however none of these guidelines rules and procedures are intended to create a requirement of cause for termination of an employee c although village employees may be discharged from employment with or without cause when a disciplinary action is involved the village supervisor shall take into account the seriousness of an offense the employees previous work record and any other relevant information when determining the type of discipline appropriate for an offense it is the general policy of the village to apply progressive discipline where possible and practical however progressive discipline is not mandatory and employees who commit serious first offenses will receive appropriate discipline up to and including termination of employment d nothing described in this section shall apply to reductions in force or reassignments due to reorganization or economic decisions of the village as further described in section 62237 herein the village retains the sole right to determine staffing level needs and organizational structure employee demotions transfers reassignments or discharges arising out of such reorganizations or reductions in force shall not be considered disciplinary action pursuant to this section  cause for disciplinary action just cause for disciplinary action up to and including termination of employment shall include but is not limited to the following actions 1 the employee has violated any provisions of this section or department policies rules or regulations 2 the employee has been under the influence of i a prescription medication taken in a manner other than that prescribed by the employees doctor  ii intoxicating liquor  iii cannabis or iv a controlled substance while on duty operating village property or equipment or performing duties associated with the employees position with the village 3 the employee has been convicted of a felony or a misdemeanor involving moral turpitude or moral depravity as specified in state statutes or village ordinance 4 the employee has violated any lawful official regulation or order or has failed to obey any proper direction made and given by a supervisor or another party acting at the direction of a supervisor 5 the employee has been guilty of insubordination or conduct tending to bring the village or its employees into disgrace or discredit 6 the employee is offensive in his conduct or language in public or towards the public village officials or fellow employees while on duty 7 the employee is incompetent inefficient or negligent in the performance of the duties of his position 8 the employee is careless or negligent with the monies of the village 9 the employee has failed to pay or make reasonable provisions for future payment of his debts to such an extent that such failure is detrimental to the reputation of the village 10 the employee has used threatened to use or attempted to use personal or political influence in securing promotion leave of absence transfer change of pay rate or character of work 11 the employee has induced or has attempted to induce an employee of the village to commit an unlawful act or to act in violation of any lawful department or official regulation or order 12 the employee has taken for his personal use from any person any fee gift or other valuable thing in the course of his work or in connection with it when such gift or other valuable thing may create a reasonable perception that the action will result in better treatment than that accorded to any other person 13 the employee has engaged in outside business activities on village time or has used village property for such activity 14 the employee has failed to maintain a satisfactory attendance record which may include habitual tardiness 15 the employee has abused the sick leave privilege 16 the employee has been negligent or careless in the operation of village property 17 the employee has violated the villages policy regarding harassment or sexual harassment 18 the employee commits any act which endangers the safety health or wellbeing of another person which is of such magnitude that the consequences act to cause a work disruption or unfavorable view of the village generally 19 the employee has committed theft or willful destruction of village property or the property of any other village employee 20 the employee has falsified or improperly amended time sheets personnel records employment applications or any other village records 21 the employee knowingly and intentionally made a false written or oral report or statement including but not limited to records pertaining to the employees time and attendance performance of duties internal inquiry personnel records employment applications and request for sick or bereavement leave 22 the employee has hisher driving privileges suspended or revoked or is prohibited from possessing or carrying a firearm when such activities are a necessary part of the employees duties 23 refusal to comply with a request for drug screening or alcohol testing where reasonable suspicion exists or where required by collective bargaining agreement or state or federal laws or the failure of the employee to submit to treatment or follow up testing for alcohol or drug abuse after testing positively in random postaccident or reasonable suspicion testing 24 refusal to contact eap in a timely manner following a mandatory referral or failure to remain in compliance with the treatment as directed   a  2 142018 general procedure for disciplinary action disciplinary action may range from oral notification of an employees unsatisfactory performance written reprimand suspension andor termination of employment 1 oral notification to employee of unacceptable performance should an employees performance attitude work habits or personal conduct fall below an acceptable level but not rise to the level of immediate termination the employees supervisor shall promptly notify the employee of such problem and if practicable assist the employee to improve himself the supervisor may allow a reasonable period of time for such improvement if practicable the supervisor will also document the notification of unacceptable performance in writing a copy of such writing shall be filed in the employees personnel file 2 written reprimand written warnings and reprimands will be used for repeated misconduct of a minor nature or for more serious misconduct which does not warrant suspension demotion or termination a written reprimand is considered more serious than an oral reprimand but less serious than suspension demotion or termination a copy of an employees written reprimand shall be filed in the employees personnel file 3 suspension an employee may be suspended without pay by a department head for reasons of misconduct negligence inefficiency insubordination unauthorized absence or any other justifiable reason not prohibited by the fair labor standards act where lesser action would be inappropriate or after previous oral or written reprimands the department head shall notify the human resources director in writing no later than 24 hours after the commencement of the suspension department heads may suspend an employee for a maximum of five days without prior approval of the village manager for suspension periods longer than five days approval of the village manager shall be obtained prior to notification of an employee 4 termination an employee may be terminated by his department head upon approval for such action by the village manager   a  2 142018 criminal charges arising out of the village or arising out of such employment may be suspended with the approval of the village manager from all rights assignments duties and employment with the village b partial payment of salary the village manager may authorize continued payment of 50 percent of regular salary to the employees suspended under this section unless the village manager shall find that the public safety the ability of the village to render public service or the public confidence in the village government would be impaired c termination of suspension the suspension from village employment pursuant to this section may be terminated by the village manager and back pay awarded to the employee if he is found not guilty or if the criminal charge as indicated herein is dropped d exception to provisions charges are pending additionally nothing herein shall bar disciplinary action against such employees up to and including termination based upon the acts or omissions of the employee which are related to the pending criminal charge  secs 6216062180  reserved article vii  grievances and appeals in general village employees are encouraged to promptly bring to the attention of their immediate supervisor any concern complaint question or grievance which relates to their work situation if for some reason an immediate supervisor is not an appropriate person to whom a particular concern can be brought employees should either contact their department head or the human resources director if either their department head or human resources director is not an appropriate person to whom a particular concern can be brought because of the nature of the issue employees should contact the village manager the village manager shall report to the village board any serious workrelated concern which has been presented to him by village employees it is the policy of the village to attempt to conduct personnel actions that are fair and that provide an open line of communication with village employees it is the desire of the village to adjust the causes of grievances informally and both supervisors and employees are expected to make every effort to resolve problems in an open direct and efficient manner   a  2 142018 procedure for grievances the following procedures shall govern the consideration of employee grievances except those covered by contract 1 an employee may present a grievance or have an employee committee selected by the employee present the grievance on behalf of the employee the following is the order for submission of a grievance a immediate supervisor b department head c human resources director d village manager 2 each level in the abovelisted order will have ten working days from receipt of the grievance to provide the employee a written response if the employee disagrees with the decision the employee will have ten working days from receipt of the decision to submit the grievance to next higher level of supervision if the grievance involves one of the listed supervisory employees the employee may submit the grievance directly to the next higher level 3 the village managers decision in the matter is final and the employee will be notified of this final decision 4 no employee shall be disciplined or discriminated against in any way because of any proper use of this grievance procedure    5192008  a  2 142018 appeals of disciplinary actions all employees are granted the right to appeal any action taken against them in connection with a disciplinary matter in such cases for personnel not covered by the rules and regulations of the fire and police commission the following provisions shall apply 1 filing the employee may file a written appeal to the human resources director not later than ten calendar days after the effective date of the disciplinary action such written appeal shall state the action which is being appealed and the reasons the action is being appealed 2 investigation and level i appeal the human resources director shall hear appeals submitted by an employee relative to any disciplinary action taken against the employee not later than ten calendar days after receipt of such an appeal the human resources director shall investigate the matter and provide the employee with a written decision and determination of facts and findings on which the decision on the appeal was based documents pertaining to the level i appeal shall be filed in the employees personnel file 3 level ii appeal not later than ten calendar days after receipt of the decision of the human resources director the employee may file a written appeal of the decision of the human resources director to the village manager the village manager shall review the determination and decision of the human resources director and render a written decision not later than five calendar days after receipt of the appeal from the employee copies of the decision shall be provided to the employee and placed in the employees personnel file the village manager shall report the appeal decision to the mayor and board of trustees    5192008  a  2 142018 review of employee personnel file in accordance to the personnel record review act 820 ilcs employment provisions state officials and employees ethics act as indicated further in of the villages municipal all officers and employees are strictly prohibited from soliciting or accepting gifts and items of value prohibited by the state officials and employees ethics act referred to as the act in this section village employees are expected to be familiar with and comply with the provisions of the act at all times  safety all employees of the village of westmont are expected to provide a safe work environment employees are expected to practice and promote safety awareness and safe work procedures the safety of village employees village contractors and their employees the public and of all municipal operations is paramount safety will take precedence over expedience or shortcuts 1 general employee responsibilities employees are expected to perform their jobs in a safe manner and attempt to reduce the possibility of accident occurrence the safety of fellow employees must be an equal concern any unsafe condition observed by employees shall be reported to supervisors as soon as practicable all employees have the responsibility to familiarize themselves with and follow the rules set forth in village safety policies and procedures as amended from time to time by the village 2 operation of village vehicles employees operating village vehicles have a special duty to always drive defensively and courteously employees must follow the standard operating procedures for motor vehicles at all times the rules of the road employees involved in traffic accidents should follow procedures set forth in the rules of the road as well as any and all procedures promulgated by their department head 3 supervisor responsibilities it is the responsibility of all department heads supervisors and managers to make the safety of human beings in the workplace a part of their daily and hourly concern this responsibility must be accepted by all who conduct the affairs of the village no matter in what capacity they may function supervisors at all levels are charged with advancing the safety and loss prevention programs outlined in village policies and procedures it shall be the responsibility of the village manager in unison with the department heads to develop and implement a proactive safety and loss control program to provide and maintain safe and healthy working conditions and to develop operating practices that will provide all employees and contractors with safe working conditions  secs 6221362235  reserved article ix  separation from employment termination date c job position seniority performance appraisal conduct and qualifications shall be considered in determining the order of reduction of force    4202009 resignation in the event that an employee street alley sidewalk or other public place or upon any private property  article iii  multifamily structure recycling definitions multifamily structure is defined for the purposes of this article as a building with more than one residential living unit which is not included in a curbside refuse recyclables and landscape waste collection service multifamily property is defined for purposes of this article as a property consisting of one or more multifamily structures owner shall mean any persons corporation partnership or entity such as a condominium or homeowners association jointly or severally having an ownership interest in a multifamily property or otherwise being responsible for solid waste collection for said multifamily property private scavenger shall mean any person firm or corporation engaged in the removal of solid waste compostable materials andor recyclable material from any location within village not covered by either an exclusive collection contract between the village and a contracted hauler or a franchise agreement between the village and a franchised hauler recyclable material is a material which would otherwise be abandoned or discarded but which can be utilized in the secondary material market recycling shall mean the process by which materials that would otherwise be disposed of or discarded are collected separated or processed and returned to the economic mainstream in the form of raw materials or products source separation shall mean a process that separates recyclable material from other refuse prior to collection for the purpose of recycling such materials  9182000 multifamily recycling program requirements all multifamily properties as defined above shall be required to institute an onsite recycling program with collection of ensure the safety of the village streets not yet formally accepted by keeping them substantially clear of unreasonable accumulations of snow and ice until final acceptance of a planned unit development or subdivisions streets this responsibility should properly rest on the developer thereof b responsibility of developer the subdivider or developer shall be responsible for keeping reasonably clear of ice and snow all dedicated unaccepted streets within a subdivision a snow of over two inches locally measured andor a snow that drifts which may obstruct or impair normal traffic movement shall be removed within six hours of the accumulation thereof if such accumulation is not removed within the aforementioned period the village will effect such removal at cost to the developer in addition the developer shall keep the streets substantially clear of ice and snow to the maximum degree possible weather conditions permitting further to ensure safety of drivers and reduce equipment damage all developers shall bridge manholes on streets that have only a base course the material used for bridging shall be comparable to that used for the base c agreement with village the developer may fulfill the obligations of this section by entering into an agreement with the village for the removal of snow and ice based upon the cost of such removal to the village the developer shall hold the village harmless and indemnified for any and all damages to subdivision street improvements resulting from ice and snow removal and shall repair any such damages prior to acceptance of such street improvements by the village the developer shall also indemnify the village for any damage to village equipment caused by improper street construction d bond requirement all developers with dedicated unaccepted streets shall post a cash bond in the following amount based upon lineal mileage of dedicated unaccepted streets under two miles  $ 250000 two miles to four miles  500000 four miles to seven miles  750000 over seven miles  1000000 such bond must be posted by november 1 of each year and will be returned to the developer upon satisfactory compliance with this section on may 1 of the following year under such bond requirement it is the responsibility of the developer to keep all dedicated unaccepted streets clear of ice and snow or contract with the village for this service either improper maintenance of ice and snow removal or failure to promptly reimburse the village for such costs or pursuant to any such service agreement will result in forfeiture of part or all of the bond e insurance requirement for contractors or subcontractors clearing streets any person performing ice or snow removal work shall maintain for a period from november 1 of any winter season liability and property damage insurance in the amount of $100000000 each person $100000000 aggregate which shall cause such person village and the villages representatives to be named reapplication for a permit required by this article the chief of police shall within 24 hours either issue a permit for a parade or open air meeting or reject the application b permits for parades and time of rejection c the applicant for a permit under this article shall be allowed to correct or complete an improper application and resubmit it to the chief of police the original 72hour required within 24 hours prior to the time of the event a new period of 48 hours will be imposed prior to which the event may not be held such 48hour period shall commence upon receipt of the corrected application  conflicting applications  limitations on issuance of permits a if the chief of police shall receive more than one application for a parade or open air meeting at the same time and the same place or on the same day the applications filed first in time shall take precedence b an application shall be considered to be at the same time for the purpose of this section if the event is scheduled to commence within two hours before or after the holding of another event c an application shall be considered to be at the same place for the purpose of this section if the requested parade route comes at any point within six blocks or any equivalent distance from the route of another parade or if the open air meeting is conducted within onehalf mile of another open air meeting d if the chief of police receives an application for more than one parade or open air meeting in a single day he may set a time for the duration of each parade or open air meeting which time shall not without the consent of the group seeking the permit be less than three hours e the chief of police shall issue permits for more than a single parade during one day in accordance with the requirements of this article  however he may not issue multiple permits beyond the point at which the issuance of an additional permit would require the continuing diversion of so great a number of police officers or other village personnel so as to prevent normal police protection or other services to the village  chief of police may prescribe conditions regulate parking the chief of police may prescribe the conditions governing any parade or open air meeting held or proposed to be held on any public street in the village should the public interest so require he may for limited periods of time prohibit or restrict parking on any street where unrestricted or restricted parking is permitted if signs are placed police officers stationed or other steps are taken to inform the public of such special discretion said provisions have been included herein as 204 the users attention is also directed to  7073 introduction this article is intended to formalize a policy for the installation of public sidewalks in the village of westmont illinois 1 reason for installation walking is a basic means of travel for citizens it is the villages desire to install paved public sidewalks in order to provide a clean and safe path for use by pedestrians 2 goal of the policy it is the villages intention to provide public sidewalks initially on at least one side of all streets in the village and on both sides of all heavilytraveled streets in order to minimize the need for pedestrians to cross over said streets to access a public sidewalk ultimately the village intends to provide public sidewalks on both sides of all streets within the villages boundaries 3 sidewalk maintenance once installed the village desires to keep its sidewalks in reasonably safe condition for use by the public to this end an inspection and repair program has been established and this is described in the attached appendix a exh a 12192005 note appendix a referenced above is not set out herein but is on file and available for inspection in the village offices location a general location 1 within the village public sidewalks shall be located along both sides of all streets in the village 2 within the rightofway public sidewalks are generally installed onefoot from the edge of the rightofway row this location may be adjusted with the public works directors approval where existing trees or obstructions interfere with the proposed location however in order to provide room for snow storage whenever possible no sidewalk should be located less than five feet from the edge of the street pavement or back edge of curb and gutter where it exists b highpriority locations wherever there are no existing public sidewalks priority shall be given to their installation in certain locations where high usage is expected such as 1 schools parks and churches at least one side of the street within a minimum of 1200 feet from the property 2 business districts both sides of streets to reduce the need for pedestrians to cross 3 arterial and collector roads both sides of streets to reduce the need for pedestrians to cross c new development and redevelopment village that public sidewalks be installed along all street rightsofway where none yet exists permits for construction of subdivisions buildings on individual lots and additions of 150 square feet or greater shall include the installation of the required sidewalks in addition any existing sidewalk that is in need of repair adjacent to said construction shall be required to be replaced as part of the permit village staff shall ensure that this requirement is being followed d special requests 1 recommended by staff village staff shall maintain a list of locations that have shown a special need for having a sidewalk 2 requested by residents from time to time the village may receive sidewalk requests from residents a separate list of these locations shall be maintained for consideration as funding becomes available in addition to the high priority locations listed above the village shall give preference to locations that would be an extension to existing sidewalks or complete an entire block also a location will more likely be moved up in priority if the resident or residents offer to pay half or all of the installation costs a when a request is received from an owner for a location that is in front of that owners lot and is adjacent to an existing sidewalk or sidewalks the village shall immediately add the location to the consideration list b when a proposed location is in front of properties with one or more owners other than the person making the request the request must include evidence that at least 51 percent of the owners desire to have the sidewalk installed otherwise the proposed sidewalk shall not be added to the consideration list exh a 12192005  exh a 362006   642007 scheduling of installation a general in order to meet the goals described above the village shall schedule the installation of sidewalks as soon as practicable as needs are identified and as funding permits b setting priorities as lists of proposed sidewalk locations are developed it may be necessary to prioritize the scheduling of the installations a high priority shall be given to those locations listed above in section 70202b special request locations shall be considered based on amount of public benefit c funding the village shall strive to provide a reasonable amount of funding each year for sidewalk installation in its annual budget in order to maximize the available funds the village shall continue its current practice of applying for federal and state grants as they become available exh a 12192005 exceptionsappeals a requirements for a waiver it is strongly recommended that village requirements for sidewalks be followed but if a waiver is desired only the village board can grant a waiver b cash inlieuof payment if a waiver is granted the costs for construction of the sidewalk of the tax board shall be filled by election by the employees of the village fire department b in addition to the officers as provided in subsection a of this section the fire chief or his designee shall be an ex officio member of the tax board unless otherwise elected to the tax board at an election held in accordance with the provisions of this division as an ex officio member the fire chief shall not have any voting privileges but shall have the right to participate in all meetings regarding the management of foreign fire insurance tax funds preparation of annual budgets or any other matter within the scope of the powers and duties of the tax board and the right to notice of any regular or special meeting in the same manner given to any voting member  provided that if the fire chief is otherwise elected to the tax board he shall have the same rights privileges and duties of the position to which he is elected 1180 1271992 elections  terms of office  removal of members  filling of vacancies the initial election of the tax board shall be held in december 199 and during the month of december in evennumbered years thereafter officers shall take office on january 1 in oddnumbered years and shall serve up to and including december 31 two years later the terms of all officers shall be two years the initial election shall be held in accordance with guidelines and procedures established by the tax boards rules and regulations governing the nomination and election of such officers for subsequent elections board members may be removed from office for just cause vacancies shall be filled by special election held in the same manner as the biennial elections held not later than 60 days after the vacancy is created 1182 1271992 foreign fire insurance tax fund a village fire department foreign fire insurance tax fund is hereby created all revenue received by the village from the foreign fire insurance tax levied by section 74277 shall be deposited in the fund and shall be held and expended according to the following procedures 1 the village treasurer shall provide the treasurer of the tax board a monthly accounting of receipts and expenditures of the fund 2 by december 31 of each year the officers of the tax board shall approve a preliminary budget for the expenditure of the funds received pursuant to the foreign fire insurance tax the officers of the tax board shall no later than april 1 adopt a final budget for the expenditure of the foreign fire insurance tax proceeds and shall by such date forward such budget to the board of trustees to be approved by ordinance by the president and board of trustees in order to comply with the statutory mandate of a prior appropriation for all expenditures the president and board of trustees shall approve the budget of the tax board by and as part of the annual appropriation ordinance the final budget may be amended at any time by a majority vote of the officers of the tax board with the concurrence of the president and board of trustees consistent with established practice expenditures shall be made only for items specifically described in the final budget as originally adopted or subsequently amended 3 the tax board shall have the power to approve the expenditure of monies from the fund for the maintenance use and benefit of the fire department any expenditure in excess of $100000 shall be subject to the approval of the president and board of trustees  provided however that such expenditure shall be approved if it is for the maintenance use and benefit of the fire department 4 any expenditure made from the fund shall be made in accordance with village rules regulations practices and ordinances and state statute as may be amended from time to time which govern the procurement of goods and services 5 no expenditure shall be made from the fund without approval of the tax board 6 the tax board treasurer shall provide bond in an amount not less than two times the amount of foreign fire insurance tax revenue to the president and board of trustees to ensure the faithful performance of the tax board treasurers duties imposed by law and by tax board rules and regulations fees for such bond shall be paid from the funds collected from the foreign fire insurance tax 7 the tax board treasurer shall be responsible for paying the service charge levied by the illinois municipal league for the collection of the foreign fire insurance tax from the proceeds of the foreign fire insurance tax  provided that such fee is chargeable by state law  and provided further that the service charge has not already been retained by the illinois municipal league prior to disbursement of the tax 1183 1271992 meetings  rules of procedure  records the tax board shall in accordance with the open meetings act establish a regular time and place for its meetings the open meetings act  shall apply to all meetings of the tax board the tax board president shall preside at the meetings which shall be conducted in accordance with roberts rules of order latest edition except to the extent modified by tax board rule the secretary shall keep a record of all resolutions proceedings and actions of the tax board and these records shall be open to the public three members of the tax board shall constitute a quorum for the transaction of its business the affirmative vote of three members of the tax board shall constitute approval of business before it special meetings upon not less than 24 hours notice may be called by the tax board president or by no less than three members of the tax board any person shall be entitled to appear and be heard on any matter before the tax board 1184 1271992 footnotes  19  5 ilcs 120101 et seq rules and regulations the tax board may reserved article x  locally imposed and administered tax rights and responsibilities title this article shall be known as and may be cited as the locally imposed and administered tax rights and responsibility   122001 scope the provisions of this article shall apply to the villages procedures in connection with all of the villages locally imposed and administered taxes  122001 definitions certain words or terms herein shall have the meaning ascribed to them as follows act means the local government taxpayers bill of rights act corporate authorities means the villages president and board of trustees local tax administrator the villages finance director is charged with the administration and collection of the locally imposed and administered taxes including staff employees or agents to the extent they are authorized by the local tax administrator to act in the local tax administrators stead the local tax administrator shall have the authority to implement the terms of this article to give full effect to this article the exercise of such authority by the local tax administrator shall not be inconsistent with this article and the act locally imposed and administered tax or tax means each tax imposed by the village that is collected or administered by the village not an agency or department of the state it does not include any taxes imposed upon real property under the property tax fees collected by the village other than infrastructure maintenance fees notice means each audit notice collection notice or other similar notice or communication in connection with each of the villages locally imposed and administered taxes tax ordinance means each ordinance adopted by the village that imposes any locally imposed and administered tax taxpayer means any person required to pay any locally imposed and administered tax and generally includes the person upon whom the legal incidence of such tax is placed and with respect to consumer taxes includes the business or entity required to collect and pay the locally imposed and administered tax to the village village means the village of westmont illinois  122001 notices unless otherwise provided whenever notice is required to be given the notice is to be in writing mailed not less than seven calendar days prior to the day fixed for any applicable hearing audit or other scheduled act of the local tax administrator the notice shall be sent by the local tax administrator as follows 1 first class or express mail or overnight mail addressed to the persons concerned at the persons last known address  or 2 personal service or delivery  122001 late payment any notice payment remittance or other filing required to be made to the village pursuant to any tax ordinance shall be considered late unless it is a physically received by the village on or before the due date or b received in an envelope or other container displaying a valid readable us postmark dated on or before the due date properly addressed to the village with adequate postage prepaid  122001 payment any payment or remittance received for a tax period shall be applied in the following order 1 first to the tax due for the applicable period  2 second to the interest due for the applicable period  and 3 third to the penalty for the applicable period  122001 certain credits and refunds a the village shall not refund or credit any taxes voluntarily paid without written protest at the time of payment in the event that a locally imposed and administered tax is declared invalidly enacted or unconstitutional by a court of competent jurisdiction however a taxpayer shall not be deemed to have paid the tax voluntarily if the taxpayer lacked knowledge of the facts upon which to protest the taxes at the time of payment or if the taxpayer paid the taxes under duress b the statute of limitations on a claim for credit or refund shall be four years after the end of the calendar year in which payment in error was made the village shall not grant a credit or refund of locally imposed and administered taxes interest or penalties to a person who has not paid the amounts directly to the village c the procedure for claiming a credit or refund of locally imposed and administered taxes interest or penalties paid in error shall be as follows 1 the taxpayer shall submit to the local tax administrator in writing a claim for credit or refund together with a statement specifying a the name of the locally imposed and administered tax subject to the claim  b the tax period for the locally imposed and administered tax subject to the claim  c the date of the tax payment subject to the claim and the canceled check or receipt for the payment  d the taxpayers recalculation accompanied by an amended or revised tax return in connection with the claim  and e a request for either a refund or a credit in connection with the claim to be applied to the amount of tax interest and penalties overpaid and as applicable related interest on the amount overpaid  provided however that there shall be no refund and only a credit given in the event the taxpayer owes any monies to the village 2 within ten days of the receipt by the local tax administrator of any claim for a refund or credit the local tax administrator shall either a grant the claim  or b deny the claim in whole or in part together with a statement as to the reason for the denial or the partial grant and denial 3 in the event the local tax administrator grants in whole or in part a claim for refund or credit the amount of the grant for refund or credit shall bear interest at the rate of five percent per annum based on a year of 365 days and the number of days elapsed from the date of the overpayment to the date of mailing of a refund check or the grant of a credit  122001 audit procedure any request for proposed audit pursuant to any local administered tax shall comply with the notice requirements of this article 1 each notice of audit shall contain the following information a the tax  b the time period of the audit  and c a brief description of the books and records to be made available for the auditor 2 any audit shall be conducted during normal business hours and if the date and time selected by the local tax administrator is not agreeable to the taxpayer another date and time may be requested by the taxpayer within 30 days after the originally designated audit and during normal business hours 3 the taxpayer may request an extension of time to have an audit conducted the audit shall be conducted not less than seven days nor more than 30 days from the date the notice is given unless the taxpayer and the local tax administrator agreed to some other convenient time in the event taxpayer is unable to comply with the audit on the date in question the taxpayer may request another date within the 30 days approved in writing that is convenient to the taxpayer and the local tax administrator 4 every taxpayer shall keep accurate books and records of the taxpayers business or activities including original source documents and books of entry denoting the transactions which had given rise or may have given rise to any tax liability exemption or deduction all books shall be kept in the english language and shall be subject to and available for inspection by the village 5 it is the duty and responsibility of every taxpayer to make available its books and records for inspection by the village if the taxpayer fails to provide the documents necessary for audit within the time provided the local tax administrator may issue a tax determination and assessment based on the tax administrators determination of the best estimate of the taxpayers tax liability 6 if an audit determines there has been an overpayment of a locally imposed and administered tax as a result of the audit written notice of the amount of overpayment shall be given to the taxpayer within 30 days of the villages determination of the amount of overpayment 7 in the event a tax payment was submitted to the incorrect local governmental entity the local tax administrator shall notify the local governmental entity imposing such tax  122001 appeal a the local tax administrator shall send written notice to a taxpayer upon the local tax administrators issuance of a protestable notice of tax due a bill a claim denial or a notice of claim reduction regarding any tax the notice shall include the following information 1 the reason for the assessment  2 the amount of the tax liability proposed  3 the procedure for appealing the assessment  and 4 the obligations of the village during the audit appeal refund and collection process b a taxpayer who receives written notice from the local tax administrator of a determination of tax due or assessment may file with the local tax administrator a written protest and petition for hearing setting forth the basis of the taxpayers request for a hearing the written protest and petition for hearing must be filed with the local tax administrator within 45 days of receipt of the written notice of the tax determination and assessment c if a timely written notice and petition for hearing is filed the local tax administrator shall fix the time and place for hearing and shall give written notice to the taxpayer the hearing shall be scheduled for a date within 14 days of receipt of the written protest and petition for hearing unless the taxpayer requests a later date convenient to all parties d if a written protest and petition for hearing is not filed within the 45day period the tax determination audit or assessment shall become a final bill due and owing without further notice e upon the showing of reasonable cause by the taxpayer and the full payment of the contested tax liability along with interest accrued as of the due date of the tax the local tax administrator may reopen or extend the time for filing a written protest and petition for hearing in no event shall the time for filing a written protest and petition for hearing be reopened or extended for more than 90 days after the expiration of the 45day period  122001 hearing a whenever a taxpayer or a tax collector has filed a timely written protest and petition for hearing under section 74349 above the local tax administrator shall conduct a hearing regarding any appeal b no continuances shall be granted except in cases where a continuance is absolutely necessary to protect the rights of the taxpayer lack of preparation shall not be grounds for a continuance any continuance granted shall not exceed 14 days c at the hearing the local tax administrator shall preside and shall hear testimony and accept any evidence relevant to the tax determination audit or assessment the strict rules of evidence applicable to judicial proceedings shall not apply d at the conclusion of the hearing the local tax administrator shall make a written determination on the basis of the evidence presented at the hearing the taxpayer or tax collector shall be provided with a copy of the written decision  122001 interest and penalties in the event a determination has been made that a tax is due and owing assessment or other bill sent the tax must be paid within the time frame otherwise indicated 1 interest the village hereby provides for the amount of interest to be assessed on a late payment underpayment or nonpayment of the tax to be five percent per annum based on a year of 365 days and the number of days elapsed 2 late filing and payment penalties if a tax return is not filed within the time and manner provided by the controlling tax ordinance a late filing penalty of five percent of the amount of tax required to be shown as due on a return shall be imposed  and a late payment penalty of five percent of the tax due shall be imposed if no return is filed within the time or manner provided by the controlling tax ordinance and prior to the village issuing a notice of tax delinquency or notice of tax liability then a failure to file penalty shall be assessed equal to 25 percent of the total tax due for the applicable reporting period for which the return was required to be filed a late filing or payment penalty shall not apply if a failure to file penalty is imposed by the controlling ordinance  122001 abatement the local tax administrator shall have the authority to waive or abate any late filing penalty late payment penalty or failure to file penalty if the local tax administrator shall determine reasonable cause exists for delay or failure to make a filing  122001 installment contracts the village may enter into an installment contract with the taxpayer for the payment of taxes under the controlling tax ordinance the local tax administrator may not cancel any installment contract so entered unless the taxpayer fails to pay any amount due and owing upon written notice by the local tax administrator that the payment is 30 days delinquent the taxpayer shall have 14 days to cure any delinquency if the taxpayer fails to cure the delinquency within the 14day period or fails to demonstrate good faith in restructuring the installment contract with the local administrator the installment contract shall be canceled without further notice to the taxpayer  122001 statute of limitations the village local tax administrator shall review all tax returns in a prompt and timely manner and inform taxpayers of any amounts due and owing the taxpayer shall have 45 days after receiving notice of the reviewed tax returns to make any request for refund or provide any tax still due and owing 1 no determination of tax due and owing may be issued more than four years after the end of the calendar year for which the return for the applicable period was filed or for the calendar year in which the return for the applicable period was due whichever occurs later 2 if any tax return is not filed or if during any fouryear period for which a notice of tax determination or assessment may be issued by the village the tax paid was less than 75 percent of the tax due the statute of limitations shall be six years maximum after the end of the calendar year in which return for the applicable period was due or end of the calendar year in which the return for the applicable period was filed 3 no statute of limitations shall not apply if a fraudulent tax return was filed by the taxpayer  122001 voluntary disclosure for any locally imposed and administered tax for which a taxpayer has not received a written notice of an audit investigation or assessment from the local tax administrator a taxpayer is entitled to file an application with the local tax administrator for a voluntary disclosure of the tax due a taxpayer filing a voluntary disclosure application must agree to pay the amount of tax due along with interest of one percent per month for all periods prior to the filing of the application but not more than four years before the date of filing the application a taxpayer filing a valid voluntary disclosure application may not be liable for any additional tax interest or penalty for any period before the date the application was filed however if the taxpayer incorrectly determined and underpaid the amount of tax due the taxpayer is liable for the underpaid tax along with applicable interest on the underpaid tax unless the underpayment was the result of fraud on the part of the taxpayer in which case the application shall be deemed invalid and void the payment of tax and interest must be made by no later than 90 days after the filing of the voluntary disclosure application or the date agreed to by the local tax administrator however any additional amounts owed as a result of an underpayment of tax and interest previously paid under this section must be paid within 90 days after a final determination and the exhaustion of all appeals of the additional amount owed or the date agreed to by the local tax administrator whichever is longer  122001 publication of tax ordinances any locally administered tax ordinance shall be published via normal or standard publishing requirements the posting of a tax ordinance on the internet shall satisfy the publication requirements copies of all tax ordinances shall be made available to the public upon request at the village clerks office  122001 internal review procedure the local tax administrator shall establish an internal review procedure regarding any liens filed against any taxpayers for unpaid taxes upon a determination by the local tax administrator that the lien is valid the lien shall remain in full force and effect if the lien is determined to be improper the local tax administrator shall 1 timely remove the lien at the villages expense  2 correct the taxpayers credit record  and 3 correct any public disclosure of the improperly imposed lien  122001 application of article this article shall be liberally construed and administered to supplement all of the villages tax ordinances to the extent that any tax ordinance is in conflict with or inconsistent with this article this article shall be controlling  122001 secs cable act as amended from time to time unless otherwise defined herein cable act or act means the cable communications policy act of 198 as amended by the cable consumer protection and competition act of 1992 and the telecommunications act of 199 as the same may be amended from time to time cable service means the oneway transmission to subscribers of video programming or other programming service and subscriber interaction if any which is required for the selection or use of such video programming or other programming service cable system or system has the meaning set forth in 47 usc  522 of the cable act and means grantees facilities consisting of a set of closed transmission paths and associated signal generation reception and control equipment that is designed to provide cable service which includes video programming and which is provided to multiple subscribers within the franchise area but such term does not include 1 a facility that serves only to retransmit the television signals of one or more television broadcast stations  2 a facility that serves subscribers without using any public rightofway  3 a facility of a common carrier which is subject in whole or in part to the provisions of title ii of the communications act of 193 as amended except that such a facility shall be considered a cable system other than for purposes of section 621c of the cable act to the extent such facility is used in the transmission of video programming directly to subscribers unless the extent of such use is solely to provide interactive ondemand services  4 an open video system that complies with section 653 of the cable act  or 5 any facilities of any electric utility used solely for operating its electric utility systems channel or cable channel means a portion of the electromagnetic frequency spectrum which is used in a cable system and which is capable of delivering a television channel as a television channel is defined by the federal communications commission
